name: Give Me A 'C' Quiz / Test | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What C was a Roman Emperor(AD 41 to AD 54) that was the first emperor chosen by the army?
questions.explanation:
Claudius I.

	Claudius was poisoned by his fourth wife, Agrippina. He was succeeded by Nero who was the son of Agrippina.

questions.text: What N is a variety of peach tree and its sweet, fleshy fruit?
questions.explanation:
Nectarine & nectarines.

	The nectarine is smooth skinned, but the tree is identical to the peach tree.

questions.text: What P is the name given to the single super-continent that formed about 240 million years ago ?
questions.explanation:
Pangaea.

	Pangaea began to break up at the end of the Triassic period.

questions.text: What B is a rare but potentially lethal form of food poisoning?
questions.explanation:
Botulism.

	Botulism is caused by a toxin produced by the bacterium, Clostridium botulinium.

questions.text: What S in biology is the hard protective case of various Mollusks?
questions.explanation:
Shell & seashell.

	The case is secreted by the epidermis of the mollusk and consists of a protein matrix strengthened by calcium carbonate.

questions.text: What L is a food fish related to cod?
questions.explanation:
Ling.

	The Ling is found in the Atlantic Ocean.

questions.text: What H is the outgrowth of mammalian skin, with insulating, protective, and sensory functions?
questions.explanation:
Hair.

	Hair color depends on the presence of Melanin in the hair cells.

questions.text: What D is a yellowish brown wild dog found in Australia?
questions.explanation:
Dingo.

	Dingos feed mainly on rabbits and other small mammals.

questions.text: What F is the elevation of body temperature above average?
questions.explanation:
Fever & febrile.

	98.6 degrees Fahrenheit and 37 degrees Centigrade is the average body temperature for humans.

questions.text: What T was the ruler of Yugoslavia from 1945 to 1980?
questions.explanation:
Tito.

	Tito was a forceful dictator who manged to keep the various nationalistic factions in Yugoslavia together.
